Index: 
===================================================================
--- 
+++ 
@@ -8,9 +8,9 @@
 # http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html
 
 # Optimize Gradle daemon settings and memory allocation
 org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4096m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=1024m -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=200 -XX:GCTimeRatio=4 -XX:AdaptiveSizePolicyWeight=90 -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8
-org.gradle.java.home=C:\\Users\\tfunk\\.gradle\\jdks\\eclipse_adoptium-17-amd64-windows.2
+org.gradle.java.home=C:\\Program Files\\Eclipse Adoptium\\jdk-17.0.13.11-hotspot
 
 # Enable parallel execution and configure worker count
 org.gradle.parallel=true
 org.gradle.workers.max=8

Index: 
===================================================================
--- 
+++ 
@@ -6,50 +6,26 @@
 
 # For more details on how to configure your build environment visit
 # http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html
 
-# Optimize Gradle daemon settings and memory allocation
-org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4096m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=1024m -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=200 -XX:GCTimeRatio=4 -XX:AdaptiveSizePolicyWeight=90 -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8
-org.gradle.java.home=C:\\Program Files\\Eclipse Adoptium\\jdk-17.0.13.11-hotspot
+# Specifies the JVM arguments used for the daemon process.
+# The setting is particularly useful for tweaking memory settings.
+# Default value: -Xmx512m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=256m
+org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2048m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
 
-# Enable parallel execution and configure worker count
-org.gradle.parallel=true
-org.gradle.workers.max=8
+# When configured, Gradle will run in incubating parallel mode.
+# This option should only be used with decoupled projects. More details, visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/multi_project_builds.html#sec:decoupled_projects
+# org.gradle.parallel=true
 
-# Enable build cache with optimizations
-org.gradle.caching=true
-org.gradle.unsafe.configuration-cache=false
-org.gradle.unsafe.configuration-cache-problems=warn
-
-# Enable build scan for performance analysis
-org.gradle.daemon.performance.enable-monitoring=true
-org.gradle.daemon.performance.disable-after-failures=10
-
-# Enable build optimizations
-android.enableBuildConfigAsBuildType=true
-android.enableR8.fullMode=true
-android.enableResourceOptimizations=true
-android.enableAppCompileTimeRClass=true
-android.enableSourceSetPathsMap=true
-android.enableNewResourceShrinker=true
-android.experimental.enableNewResourceShrinker.preciseShrinking=true
-android.experimental.cacheCompileLibResources=true
-android.experimental.enableSourceSetPathsMap=true
-android.experimental.enableArtifactTransform=false
-android.enableDexingArtifactTransform=false
-android.suppressUnsupportedCompileSdk=34
-
-# Increase daemon idle timeout
-org.gradle.daemon.idletimeout=10800000
-
-# Enable daemon
-org.gradle.daemon=true
-
 # AndroidX package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the
 # Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK
 # https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/androidx-rn
 android.useAndroidX=true
 
+# Automatically convert third-party libraries to use AndroidX
+android.enableJetifier=true
+
 # Use this property to specify which architecture you want to build.
 # You can also override it from the CLI using
 # ./gradlew <task> -PreactNativeArchitectures=x86_64
 reactNativeArchitectures=armeabi-v7a,arm64-v8a,x86,x86_64
@@ -63,4 +39,22 @@
 
 # Use this property to enable or disable the Hermes JS engine.
 # If set to false, you will be using JSC instead.
 hermesEnabled=true
+
+# Enable Gradle Daemon
+org.gradle.daemon=true
+
+# Enable Configure on demand
+org.gradle.configureondemand=true
+
+# Enable parallel builds
+org.gradle.parallel=true
+
+# Enable Build Cache
+org.gradle.caching=true
+
+# Android SDK Configuration
+android.compileSdk=34
+android.targetSdk=34
+android.minSdk=21
+android.buildToolsVersion=35.0.0

-# Android
+# IDE (e.g. Android Studio) users:

+
+# For more details on how to configure your build environment visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html
+
+# Specifies the JVM arguments used for the daemon process.
+# The setting is particularly useful for tweaking memory settings.
+# Default value: -Xmx512m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=256m
+org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2048m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
+
+# When configured, Gradle will run in incubating parallel mode.

+# https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/androidx-rn

 android.enableJetifier=true
-android.nonTransitiveRClass=true

-kotlin.code.style=official

+

-android.buildTools.version=35.0.0
-android.minSdk=21

+# Enable GIF support in React Native images (~200 B increase)
+expo.gif.enabled=true
+# Enable webp support in React Native images (~85 KB increase)
+expo.webp.enabled=true
+# Enable animated webp support (~3.4 MB increase)
+# Disabled by default because iOS doesn't support animated webp
+expo.webp.animated=false
+
+# Enable network inspector
+EX_DEV_CLIENT_NETWORK_INSPECTOR=true

===================================================================
--- 
+++ 
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@
+# Project-wide Gradle settings.
+
+# IDE (e.g. Android Studio) users:
+# Gradle settings configured through the IDE *will override*
+# any settings specified in this file.
+
+# For more details on how to configure your build environment visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html
+
+# Specifies the JVM arguments used for the daemon process.
+# The setting is particularly useful for tweaking memory settings.
+# Default value: -Xmx512m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=256m
+org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2048m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
+
+# When configured, Gradle will run in incubating parallel mode.
+# This option should only be used with decoupled projects. More details, visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/multi_project_builds.html#sec:decoupled_projects
+# org.gradle.parallel=true
+
+# AndroidX package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the
+# Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK
+# https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/androidx-rn
+android.useAndroidX=true
+
+# Automatically convert third-party libraries to use AndroidX
+android.enableJetifier=true
+
+# Use this property to specify which architecture you want to build.
+# You can also override it from the CLI using
+# ./gradlew <task> -PreactNativeArchitectures=x86_64
+reactNativeArchitectures=armeabi-v7a,arm64-v8a,x86,x86_64
+
+# Use this property to enable support to the new architecture.
+# This will allow you to use TurboModules and the Fabric render in
+# your application. You should enable this flag either if you want
+# to write custom TurboModules/Fabric components OR use libraries that
+# are providing them.
+newArchEnabled=false
+
+# Use this property to enable or disable the Hermes JS engine.
+# If set to false, you will be using JSC instead.
+hermesEnabled=true
+
+# Suppress the unsupported compileSdk version warning
+android.suppressUnsupportedCompileSdk=34
+
+# Opt-in to the future behavior for Maven publishing
+android.disableAutomaticComponentCreation=true
+
+# Set JDK 17 for Gradle daemon
+org.gradle.java.home=C:\\Program Files\\Eclipse Adoptium\\jdk-17.0.9.9-hotspot
+
+kotlinVersion=1.9.24
+
+# Use the stable version instead of the snapshot
+reactNativeVersion=0.72.7

--- 
+++ 
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+# Project-wide Gradle settings.
+
+# IDE (e.g. Android Studio) users:
+# Gradle settings configured through the IDE *will override*
+# any settings specified in this file.
+
+# For more details on how to configure your build environment visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html
+
+# Specifies the JVM arguments used for the daemon process.
+# The setting is particularly useful for tweaking memory settings.
+# Default value: -Xmx512m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=256m
+org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2048m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
+
+# When configured, Gradle will run in incubating parallel mode.
+# This option should only be used with decoupled projects. More details, visit
+# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/multi_project_builds.html#sec:decoupled_projects
+# org.gradle.parallel=true
+
+# AndroidX package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the
+# Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK
+# https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/androidx-rn
+android.useAndroidX=true
+
+# Automatically convert third-party libraries to use AndroidX
+android.enableJetifier=true
+
+# Use this property to specify which architecture you want to build.
+# You can also override it from the CLI using
+# ./gradlew <task> -PreactNativeArchitectures=x86_64
+reactNativeArchitectures=armeabi-v7a,arm64-v8a,x86,x86_64
+
+# Use this property to enable support to the new architecture.
+# This will allow you to use TurboModules and the Fabric render in
+# your application. You should enable this flag either if you want
+# to write custom TurboModules/Fabric components OR use libraries that
+# are providing them.
+newArchEnabled=false
+
+# Use this property to enable or disable the Hermes JS engine.
+# If set to false, you will be using JSC instead.
+hermesEnabled=true
+
+# Suppress the unsupported compileSdk version warning
+android.suppressUnsupportedCompileSdk=34
+
+# Set JDK 17 for Gradle daemon
+org.gradle.java.home=C\:\\Program Files\\Eclipse Adoptium\\jdk-17.0.13.11-hotspot
+
+kotlinVersion=1.8.10
+
+# Use the stable version instead of the snapshot
+reactNativeVersion=0.72.7

Index: 
===================================================================
--- 
+++ 
@@ -9,9 +9,9 @@
 
 # Specifies the JVM arguments used for the daemon process.
 # The setting is particularly useful for tweaking memory settings.
 # Default value: -Xmx512m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=256m
-org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2048m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=512m
+org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4096m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=1024m
 
 # When configured, Gradle will run in incubating parallel mode.
 # This option should only be used with decoupled projects. More details, visit
 # http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/multi_project_builds.html#sec:decoupled_projects

commits.name: Commit-0
commits.content:
# Project-wide Gradle settings.

# IDE (e.g. Android Studio) users:
# Gradle settings configured through the IDE *will override*
# any settings specified in this file.

# For more details on how to configure your build environment visit
# http://www.gradle.org/docs/current/userguide/build_environment.html

# Optimize Gradle daemon settings and memory allocation
org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx4096m -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=1024m -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=200 -XX:GCTimeRatio=4 -XX:AdaptiveSizePolicyWeight=90 -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8
org.gradle.java.home=C:\\Users\\tfunk\\.gradle\\jdks\\eclipse_adoptium-17-amd64-windows.2

# Enable parallel execution and configure worker count
org.gradle.parallel=true
org.gradle.workers.max=8

# Enable build cache with optimizations
org.gradle.caching=true
org.gradle.unsafe.configuration-cache=false
org.gradle.unsafe.configuration-cache-problems=warn

# Enable build scan for performance analysis
org.gradle.daemon.performance.enable-monitoring=true
org.gradle.daemon.performance.disable-after-failures=10

# Enable build optimizations
android.enableBuildConfigAsBuildType=true
android.enableR8.fullMode=true
android.enableResourceOptimizations=true
android.enableAppCompileTimeRClass=true
android.enableSourceSetPathsMap=true
android.enableNewResourceShrinker=true
android.experimental.enableNewResourceShrinker.preciseShrinking=true
android.experimental.cacheCompileLibResources=true
android.experimental.enableSourceSetPathsMap=true
android.experimental.enableArtifactTransform=false
android.enableDexingArtifactTransform=false
android.suppressUnsupportedCompileSdk=34

# Increase daemon idle timeout
org.gradle.daemon.idletimeout=10800000

# Enable daemon
org.gradle.daemon=true

# AndroidX package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the
# Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK
# https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/androidx-rn
android.useAndroidX=true

# Use this property to specify which architecture you want to build.
# You can also override it from the CLI using
# ./gradlew <task> -PreactNativeArchitectures=x86_64
reactNativeArchitectures=armeabi-v7a,arm64-v8a,x86,x86_64

# Use this property to enable support to the new architecture.
# This will allow you to use TurboModules and the Fabric render in
# your application. You should enable this flag either if you want
# to write custom TurboModules/Fabric components OR use libraries that
# are providing them.
newArchEnabled=false

# Use this property to enable or disable the Hermes JS engine.
# If set to false, you will be using JSC instead.
hermesEnabled=true
